oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of three treatments for bovine endometritis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sheldon, I. M.
Noakes, D. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: endometritis
hydrochloride solution
cloprostenol
intramuscular injection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three commercial preparations for the treatment of bovine endometritis were compared: an intrauterine infusion of 1500 mg oxytetracycline hydrochloride solution, an intramuscular injection of 500 μg cloprostenol (a synthetic analogue of prostaglandin F2α), and an intramuscular injection of 3 mg oestradiol benzoate/500 kg estimated bodyweight. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1998) 142, 575-579.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 61
